title: Refraction - index from speeds for blocks 1 and 2

content.question: A beam of light passes through two transparent blocks made of different materials. Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> has an index of refraction <math alttext="n sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, and the light passes through it with a speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>. Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> has an index of refraction <math alttext="n sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and the light passes through it with a speed <math alttext="4 v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mi>v</mi></math>. What is the ratio <math alttext="n sub 1 to n sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> ?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
